events.message: Customer reported a car accident that occurred on April 30th involving rear-end collision at a traffic light.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after confirming keywords related to vehicle collision and damages.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle this auto accident claim and oversee the subsequent processes.
The customer received confirmation acknowledging the claim submission for the vehicle accident and next steps.
Request was made for photos of the damaged car, police report, and driver’s license for further evaluation.
The customer successfully submitted all requested documents including police report and photos of the collision.
Investigation into the circumstances of the auto accident began to verify liability and extent of damage.
The investigation concluded that the other driver was at fault, and damage assessment was finalized.
A settlement amount was proposed to cover vehicle repair costs and rental car reimbursement.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and appreciated the timely updates.
Claim was officially approved based on investigation findings and document verification.
The settlement amount was paid to the customer’s bank account to cover repair and other expenses.
The auto accident claim was closed following payment and confirmation of repair initiation by customer.
All claim documents and records were archived for future reference and regulatory compliance.
